main

Class MainMenuUIController

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.MainMenuUIController

  • public class MainMenuUIController
extends java.lang.Object
    This class controls all of the UI elements displayed while in the main menu scene.
    Author:
    Stanton Parham (stparham@ncsu.edu)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MainMenuUIController()
      The constructor that sets the instance field to reference this; THIS SHOULD ACTUALLY NEVER BE USED.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void closeProgram(javafx.event.ActionEvent e)
      Just a way to quickly exit the program;
      static MainMenuUIController getInstance()
      Returns the instance of the MainMenuUIController class;
      void hideLabel(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent e)
      Hides the menu buttons' labels when the mouse exits their region;
      void showExtrasMenu(javafx.event.ActionEvent e)
      Shows the extras pane that has several options, a button for seeing information about the game, and the high scores for the game;
      void showLabel(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent e)
      Shows the menu buttons' labels when the mouse enters their region;
      void showSaveSelector(javafx.event.ActionEvent e)
      Shows the save selector pane and all of its components; The save selector pane allows the user to either overwrite a previous save and create a new game or load a previous save depending on the button that they press in the main menu.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • MainMenuUIController

        public MainMenuUIController()
        The constructor that sets the instance field to reference this; THIS SHOULD ACTUALLY NEVER BE USED. IT'S ONLY INCLUDED SO THAT THE instance FIELD WILL BE ABLE TO REFERENCE THE ACTUAL MainMenuUIController OBJECT. THERE SHOULD NEVER BE ANY TIME WHERE THIS CLASS IS USED AS AN ACTUAL OBJECT.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static MainMenuUIController getInstance()
        Returns the instance of the MainMenuUIController class;
        Returns:
        a reference to the MainMenuUIController instance;

      • showExtrasMenu

        public void showExtrasMenu(javafx.event.ActionEvent e)
        Shows the extras pane that has several options, a button for seeing information about the game, and the high scores for the game;
        Parameters:
        e - the ActionEvent from the Options/Extras Button on the main menu

      • showSaveSelector

        public void showSaveSelector(javafx.event.ActionEvent e)
        Shows the save selector pane and all of its components; The save selector pane allows the user to either overwrite a previous save and create a new game or load a previous save depending on the button that they press in the main menu.
        Parameters:
        e - the ActionEvent from the Button that was pressed in the main menu

      • showLabel

        public void showLabel(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent e)
        Shows the menu buttons' labels when the mouse enters their region;
        Parameters:
        e - the onEnter MouseEvent from the button

      • hideLabel

        public void hideLabel(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent e)
        Hides the menu buttons' labels when the mouse exits their region;
        Parameters:
        e - the onExit MouseEvent from the button

      • closeProgram

        public void closeProgram(javafx.event.ActionEvent e)
        Just a way to quickly exit the program;
        Parameters:
        e - an ActionEvent from the exitBtn in the FXML
